column4: to everyone, i installed jackd & jackEQ in order to change the assignment of my front panel mic (input) to headphone (output) but jackeq is not starting up any other suggestions on how to reassign my jacks?
you are using ubuntu studio?
i dont think i have studio i have heron hardy
hardy heron ubuntu studio?
how can i find out if i do or not
do you have the ubuntu studio start up splash screen? that is always a good indication :)
no just a normal ubuntu screen like the ubuntu logo with a knight rider bar in orange under it
if you are using jack you may wish to get ubuntu studio with the rt kernel
I didnt want to use jack i was told by pvl1 that it might help me reassign those oputputs, if you know of an easier maby better way im down to learn, thank you for your help
btw ive only been using linux/ubuntu for about five days but i am willing to work with terminal and or gui
thank you ill use synaptic?
if you want to install the repos and then change sure; you can ask in their channel (or here) for more info
clarify that a bit (dumb it down fo me)
you can add their software sources (aka repositories, or repos), then update your system and install the packages etc (programs for audio/video and a real time low latency kernel)
their channel or that link would be the definitive voice though as I have not used it in ages :)
ok, the first package would be ubuntustudio-desktop? they have many packages and i dont want to install in a bad order
that would pull in everything (be warned: big download)
ok how do i get to their channel? ive only been using this xchat/irc for 2 days, im am a windows junkie trying to reform
lol its cool no worries
read the link then type /join #ubuntustudio
sorry
